p: Notwithstanding this potential, the evidence for reassortment of LAVs and wild-type strains is extremely limited. As cited above [1], the WHO document background section cites, as evidence of a safety concern, a single example to support a general concern about reassortment, and doubt remains whether the patientâ€™s illness was due to an LAV-wild-type reassortant or wild-type virus. In addition, the isolate from the patient (SA/184/10) was re-evaluated by full genomic sequencing and found not to be a reassortant [2].
